column3:
Concept ACK -- "positive" means greater than zero by definition, so the error message was incorrect

I think you should squash those commits.

Welcome as new contributor by the way! :tada:
> Welcome as new contributor by the way!\n\nTHANKS @theStack
ACK 89860a8b52c7c84b987169ce238d8e8bc809ae7b. Agree with the concept, changes are no-risk.

Concept ACK -- This error also appears some other places. Here are the first two I found from `git grep "vout must be positive"`, but there were some others.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/d052f5e6b79b9600f929457e9280b441b772785b/src/bitcoin-tx.cpp#L599-L600
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/ffaac6e6142a1cf61e8e12d7fc406fcb02300144/src/rpc/rawtransaction_util.cpp#L177-L179
> This error also appears some other places.\n\nAddressed. @adaminsky
Could be a scripted diff to show the replacement is complete?
I was not familiar with scripted diff, I will replace my commit with with script diff enabled. @MarcoFalke

Please insert an empty line in your commit message between the title of the commit and the body, otherwise it appears like this in one-line summary format:\n```\n* f56bff455f6b965cd4f50ec8e6fe2bf5981ca30d scripted diff: Improve invalid vout value rpc error message -BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT- r() { sed -i 's/vout must be positive/vout cannot be negative/g' $1 } r src/bitcoin-tx.cpp r src/rpc/rawtransac
Instead of hardcoding the file names, you can use `$(git grep -l 'vout must be positive')`
Yes, much better now. Thanks for the suggestoin @MarcoFalke
